title: Bootable USB to bootable DVD transfer problem

forumNotes.author: xakep
forumNotes.content:
I am pretty new to this so I have to ask some of you proficient guys to help me on this matter. Using Win SetupFromUSB I made bootable USB with XP and 7 setups and in addition Hiren's and Active Boot Disk. It works on VM Player so I assume it would most likely work on real machines (I am waiting to complete everything before I start using it with real machines). Then I tried to transfer all of these to a multiboot DVD. It seems that rescue part works but I got problems with Win installations, especially with XP. I have to ask someone of you to try to translate these grub4dos commands from USB to DVD booting:
title First part of Windows XP Professional setup root (hd0,0) chainloader (hd0,0)/$WIN_NT$.\~BT/SETUPLDR.BIN savedefault 1 title Second part of Windows XP Professional setup root (hd0,0) chainloader (hd0,0)/NTLDR savedefault I tried everything I could figure but it just doesn't work. Cheers!

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Try this (though I can't guarantee that it will work). It assumes the /NTLDR is not on theroot of the CD. Use chenall latest build of grub4dos (use RMPrepUSB to install it :-) )
title First part of Windows XP Professional setup chainloader (bd)/$WIN_NT$.\~BT/SETUPLDR.BIN title Second part of Windows XP Professional setup find --set-root /NTLDR chainloader /NTLDR

forumNotes.author: xakep
forumNotes.content:
Thanks for quick reply but it doesn't work: ``` chainloader (bd)/$WIN_NT$.~BT/SETUPLDR.BIN Error23: Error while parsing number ```
_______________ NTLDR is on root.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: can you move SETUPLDR,BIN to the root and then change the menu to chainloader (bd)/SETUPLDR.BIN and for NTLDR menu try ``` title Second part of Windows XP Professional setup find --devices=h --set-root /NTLDR chainloader /NTLDR ```

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
XP setup behaves in a different way when booted from HD and CD-like media.  
The source prepared for HD installation is not (easily) transferable for CD media. Translating grub4dos menu entries are your least problem.  

You might prefer using this as a starting point:  
[http://flyakite.msfn.org/](http://flyakite.msfn.org/ "External link")  
[http://bootcd.narod.ru/bcdw_e.htm](http://bootcd.narod.ru/bcdw_e.htm "External link")  
[http://www.msfn.org/...ently-xp-vista/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/99823-bootmgr-based-multiboot-dvd-currently-xp-vista/ "External link")  

Or give Sardu a try and prepare a multiboot DVD ISO:  
<http://reboot.pro/forum/100/.>
